newsitem.title: BANGLADESH: Bangladesh taka closes up as call rates rise.
newsitem.headline: Bangladesh taka closes up as call rates rise.

text.p: A sharp hike in call rates and the closure of international markets helped the Bangladesh taka gain to close at 42.8350/8450 to the dollar in interbank trading on Saturday, dealers said. The previous close was at 42.8480/8500.
The Taka opened at 42.8450/8500 per dollar amid queries from petroleum importers but edged up on the absence of any major deal due to the closure of international financial markets.

Dealers said a rise in call money rates also put pressure on the U.S. currency. Call money was traded at 7.0 to 7.75 percent, up from the previous 5.5-6.0 percent, following Wednesday's auction of central bank bills worth about 5.7 billion taka.
